titleStmt.title: The bowing the heart of subjects to their sovereign. A sermon preached on the 24th of May, 1660. Being a day of publick thanksgiving to the Lord for raising up his Excellency the Lord General Monck, and other eminent persons, who have been instrumental in the delivery of this nation from thraldom and misery. By Francis Walsall D.D. and rector of Sandy in Bedfordshire.
titleStmt.author: Walsall, Francis, d. 1661.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for John Sherley at the golden Pelican in Little-Britain,

notesStmt.note: Running title reads: A sermon preached on May 24, 1660. Being a day of publike thanksgiving.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
